subheader: Visiting a school to raise awareness
description: ENG-GAGE is an ongoing initiative dedicated to teaching younger students/communities about applications of engineering and other STEM-related topics. ENG-GAGE runs various activities throughout the year, including presenting, hosting competitions, and running projects/labs!
listItems: üìù Gain professional experience event-planning, presenting, and hosting events for career development
ü§ù Learn more about what EWB does and how we make a difference in the local community

description: An engineering design team aiming to develop efficient, ethical, and cost-effective solar energy for use in rural and remote communities. The solar home system developed by SUSTAIN-EE will provide a more accessible, ethical source of solar energy for developing countries and remote regions lacking electricity.
workDescription: The SUSTAIN-EE team will work along with professors to develop cutting-edge solar power technology using printed solar panels.

s1.title: Electrical + Solar Subteam
desc: Weather forecasting using a system of sensors and transmitters.
Use ASCA¬Æ thin film solar panels, and use Simulink to simulate our entire system

s2.title: Electronics + Software Subteam
desc: Using low-power microcontrollers and microprocessors such as the ESP32 and the Orange Pi
Performing weather prediction using statistics and machine learning

s3.title: Mechanical Subteam
desc: Adjusting the angle of solar panel to the angle of sun rays for maximum power output, known as sun tracking
Some thermal analysis, looking at more efficient heating for homes

subheader: Developing cost-effective bionics for people in need
description: An engineering design team dedicated to representing and supporting biomedical engineers in the creation of a prosthetic limb. The prosthetic developed by the Bionics team will provide a more accessible and affordable alternative for patients who have lost limbs due to various medical circumstances.
workDescription: The Bionics team will combine mechanical, technical, electrical, and biological knowledge to develop and design a prosthetic arm by working in sub-teams.

s1.title: Mechanical Engineering Subteam
desc: Bones, Joints, Muscles, Interchangeable hand attachment, materials

s2.title: Electrical + Computer Engineering Subteam
desc: Signal processing, battery, sensors, guidance system

description: The Firefly system is designed to assist and protect firefighting units in their operations. The firefly system will have various robots that clear heavy fires and smoke along the paths of firefighting units to ensure a safer environment for them to rescue.

An engineering design team dedicated to reducing the waster generated by 3D prints by developing a method for recycling it back into usable filament. The filament extruder developed by the Project R3D team will create a more sustainable alternative for 3D printing and help SFU meet its Sustainable Development Goals.
workDescription: The Project R3D team will design a modified version of the Lyman filament extruder focusing on PLA filament.

about.title: Four Components of Project R3D
points: Shredding: Shred old 3D prints into small pieces to be fed to extruder
Extrusion: melts shredded pieces and extrudes into filament
Spooling: Cools and winds filament into a spool
Firmware and Electronics: Design custom PCBs and wiring for all electronics
